tusc72 wrote:
> Hi, I have a class that loads data from a file in it's constructor. To 
> easy test this class, I delegate the loading to a method, initData(). 

As a general design suggestion, do /not/ do anything interesting in a 
constructor. I recommend instead having a "named constructor" (creation 
method) to load the data, and have the constructor accept the data as a 
parameter. The whole thing is generally better and specifically easier 
to test.

class Command {
     Command load(File fromFile) {
         data = ...;
         return new Command(data);
     }
}

You would avoid the mistake you made in your code, which was overriding 
the "load()" method without setting the 'data' field you want to read in 
execute(). This is not a JUnit problem. :)
